title: The 8 Women Changing the Watch World
summary: It's about time. Watch CEOs, collectors and tastemakers who are changing the face of the industry.. Cigars, whiskey, cars.... Watches could easily come next in that series of boy's-club clichés. Yet in the case of watches and watch collecting, times are changing. Despite the long history of male-oriented watch design and marketing, female clients, executives and creatives are in an ever more influential position.

title: Iran Sends a Message to Biden
summary: The new president shows who really runs the Islamic Republic.. The Islamic Republic of Iran isn't a real democracy. But the result of Friday's presidential election still reveals important truths about the government that the U.S. and Europe are trying to appease on nuclear weapons.

title: Colorado Lets Cities Set Their Own Gun Laws, and Boulder Plans to Move Quickly
summary: Gov. Jared Polis signed repeal of law that gun-rights supporters have successfully pushed in dozens of states. BOULDER, Colo.-In response to a new state law allowing local governments to set their own gun regulations, city leaders here want to reinstate a ban on the sale and possession of weapons such as the AR-15-style pistol used in a mass shooting at a supermarket in March.

title: A Father's Day Quest: Unraveling the Mystery of Your Dad
summary: Our dads can be an enigma. We talked to communication expert Deborah Tannen to get advice on how to understand our fathers better, even if they're gone.. How well do you know your dad?

title: Iranian Hard-Liner Wins Presidency Amid Nuclear Talks
summary: Resume Subscription. TEHRAN-A hard-line Iranian judge opposed to the country's outreach to the West won Iran's presidential election, consolidating conservative control over the country's politics, as Tehran attempts to revive an international nuclear accord that would free the country of some U.S. sanctions.

title: Who Is Ebrahim Raisi? Hard-Line Judge Wins Iran's 2021 Presidential Election
summary: Conservative candidate with close ties to Iran's supreme leader received about 62% of the vote. Iranian chief justice Ebrahim Raisi won the country's presidential election early Saturday, after the remaining candidates in the race conceded, including his politically moderate main challenger.

title: The New Test for Central Bankers' Cool: Booming House Prices
summary: Norway's central bank signaled it will raise interest rates to curb a property boom. Other policy makers could be tempted to make a similar mistake. With consumer prices rising sharply, central bankers are having to work hard to resist the temptation to lift interest rates. A real-estate boom could make the job even tougher.

title: Future of U.S. Healthcare May Be Playing Out in Nevada
summary: Resume Subscription. Nevada recently adopted a law that increases the state's role in healthcare, a move that is being closely watched as an experiment in what the future of healthcare might look like across the nation.

summary: Resume Subscription. Like other manufacturers struggling with wobbly supply chains, sports-vehicle maker Polaris Inc. is deciding what to produce based on what parts it has on hand.

title: Brooks vs. Bryson: The Feud Energizing the U.S. Open
summary: The hostility between Brooks Koepka and Bryson DeChambeau has invigorated golf fans. This is what it sounded like at Torrey Pines.. SAN DIEGO-Bryson DeChambeau has a habit of muttering to himself. "Two days in a row I've missed it far left," he said to no one in particular after bogeying the par-3 third hole Friday. "That's unbelievable."

title: Tips to Stop Your Kids From Using Your Credit Card on Videogames
summary: Resume Subscription. Trish Gilbert didn't realize how much money her two sons were spending on digital goods in "Fortnite" during the pandemic until she reviewed her credit-card statements from last year to prepare for taxes. The total for 2020 came to $955.

title: New York Mayoral Candidate Maya Wiley Gains in Polls
summary: Progressive groups back former civil-rights lawyer, who is second in recent poll after Eric Adams. Progressive groups are coalescing behind candidate Maya Wiley in the final stretch before New York City's mayoral primary, in an effort to block the moderate Democrat Eric Adams, Brooklyn's borough president, who is leading in recent polls.

title: Thailand Once Shut Out Covid-19 but Is Now Pivoting to Living With It
summary: Resume Subscription. Last year, Thailand was one of the world's top performers at fighting the coronavirus. It sacrificed the tourism dollars that normally buoy its economy to shut out Covid-19. In September, it celebrated 100 consecutive days of no locally transmitted infections.

title: What Is Juneteenth, the Newest Federal Holiday?
summary: Annual celebration commemorating the day when the last enslaved African-Americans were informed that they were free is now an official federal holiday. Juneteenth is an annual holiday observing the end of slavery in the U.S. and marks the day (June 19, 1865) when news of emancipation reached people in the deepest parts of the former Confederacy in Galveston, Texas.

title: The New Tween Status Look: LoveShackFancy Dresses and Golden Goose Sneakers
summary: Look closely, and you'll start to see packs of young women together wearing near-identical versions of this pricey, viral outfit. Off Brand is a column that delves into trends in fashion and beauty.

title: Ryan Lochte Fails to Qualify for the Tokyo Olympics
summary: The 12-time Olympic medalist fell short in his bid to make the U.S. swim team. Ryan Lochte left the Rio 2016 Olympics in disgrace. He wanted to erase those memories by making it to the Tokyo 2021 Olympics.

title: High-Intensity Workouts to Avoid Dad Bod
summary: Resume Subscription. When country singer Russell Dickerson became a father in September, he vowed he wouldn't succumb to dad bod. With less time for the gym, he embraced high-intensity workouts and found ways to include his son Remington in them.

title: For Many Home Buyers, a 5% Down Payment Isn't Enough
summary: Resume Subscription. Would-be home buyers without big piles of cash are getting left on the sidelines.

title: Hunt Is On for High-School Graduates Who Left the College Path
summary: Schools use phone calls and scholarships to lure pandemic graduates back to campus. Hundreds of thousands of students who graduated from high school last spring veered off the path to higher education, diverted by the pandemic. Now high schools and colleges are trying to set them back on track.

title: EV Startups Are in Trouble. Investors Don't Care.
summary: Shares of new electric-vehicle makers Lordstown Motors, Nikola and Canoo are holding tight despite a challenging series of speed bumps. Lordstown Motors Corp. , an electric-truck startup, is off to a bumpy start as a public company. In the past month, it said it missed its targets on costs and production, acknowledged it overstated preorders, told investors it didn't have enough money to start full production and parted with its CEO and CFO.

title: The World Relies on One Chip Maker in Taiwan, Leaving Everyone Vulnerable
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.'s dominance poses risks to the global economy, amid geopolitical tensions and a major chip shortage. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. 's chips are everywhere, though most consumers don't know it.

title: Golfing With the Father I Never Knew
summary: Inheriting a set of golf clubs gave the author a way to connect with the man who abandoned him before he was born. For most of my life, I had no interest in learning about my father. On a stateside leave from the German front in 1944, he had married my mother, impregnated her and returned to the war. He never came back. Until I was in college, all my mother told me about him was that he was "missing in World War II."

title: The Executive Who Helps Salesforce Stay True to Its Founders' Philanthropic Pledge
summary: Ebony Beckwith started her career in operations and rose to oversee charitable giving and the software giant's foundation. In Personal Board of Directors, top business leaders talk about the people they turn to for advice, and how those people have shaped their perspective and helped them succeed. Previous installments from the series are here.

title: Why PCs Are Turning Into Giant Phones
summary: Apple is dragging Microsoft, Google and the entire PC industry into the 21st century. Your next laptop will be like a smartphone-only bigger, more powerful and more capable. It's a reversal of almost a decade of trends in mobile computing, a decade that saw our phones get ever faster while our laptops and other PCs felt like they just wheezed along.

title: Investor, Trader, Speculator: Which One Are You?
summary: Understanding the difference between speculation and investing is essential to avoiding reckless risk. I've had it.
